title: NBA notes: Warriors' coach to miss opener
text:
NBA notes: Warriors' coach to miss opener October 25, 2015 Last updated: Sunday, October 25, 2015, 1:21 AM FROM NEWS SERVICE REPORTS | Print 
What has been speculated is now official: Steve Kerr will not be on the bench when the Golden State Warriors begin the defense of their NBA title Tuesday night, and could miss a number of games as he continues to recover from back surgery. 
General manager Bob Myers confirmed Saturday that Kerr, who attended practice, still isn’t ready to return to the bench. He left the team at the outset of training camp. Luke Walton will continue to serve as interim head coach until Kerr is able to return. 
"I talked to Steve and he is improving, but there still is no timeline as to when he’s coming back," Myers said. "He’s confident he will be back, but it’s all speculation as to when. 
"So he told the team that Luke’s going to start the season as the coach, and they’re fully aware that they’re going to have to accept more responsibility. Luke we have full confidence in, he has a great staff around him." 
Myers said Kerr would continue to stay engaged with the team and talk to Walton frequently. 
"Luke will hold down the fort until Luke’s able to come back, and stay back," Myers said. 
Kerr will be present before Tuesday’s game against the New Orleans Pelicans to take part in the championship ring ceremony. 
BRIEFS: The Dallas Mavericks have waived center Samuel Dalembert and three others as they trim their roster to get ready for the regular season. Also waived were Brandon Ashley, Jamil Wilson and Tu Holloway. … The Minnesota Timberwolves have waived point guard Lorenzo Brown, forward Nick Wiggins and center Kleon Penn. … The Atlanta Hawks got down to their 15-man roster by waiving center Earl Barron and forward DeQuan Jones.
